File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_AcademyAltar.lsj
Synopsis:
The player discovers an altar in the temple of Shar. They can choose to pray at it, with the chance to receive a buff or debuff depending on the outcome of a religion check. Shar and Selune tags automatically get buff and debuff respectively. Avatar Shadowheart gets a unique and ambigous outcome, casting some doubt on her standing with her goddess.

0:0 - Feign a prayer while your patron thieves the altar's magic.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_CorpsePit_PAD_TriggeredShadows.lsj
Synopsis:
After being teleported into a pit filled with bones, the player notices shadows gathering around them as the air gets colder. The player should feel a sense of dread

0:0 - Something's coming. Something dark.
1:0 - It's cold in this... grave. The shadows darken. Some horror is at hand.
2:0 - Cold, check. Looming dread, check. Brace yourselves.
3:0 - My blood freezes and my bones chill. Something's coming - I can feel it...
4:0 - Gods... there's something worse than the cold and the corpses in this pit. I can feel it.
5:0 - Hells - I feel the cold closing in. Something's coming. Something bad.
6:0 - So cold... there's something coming. I can feel it in the shadows...

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_LastJusticiar_RatsNegotiate.lsj
Synopsis:
The player continues to kill the rats. The rats begin to group up and attempt to bargain with the player. Their memories are starting to converge into a single consciousness of the last dark justiciar. Some players who accepted a quest from the Orthon may realise there is a Dark Justiciar in hiding, amongst these rats. If the player repeatedly talks to the rats at this point without accepting a truce, they'll turn hostile.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_LastJusticiar_RatsPanicked.lsj
Synopsis:
After killing some of the rats, they become more panicked and aggressive - but also a litte more lucid- something the companions may pick up on. The may start to remember things -fragments of a memory, or a name on the tip of their tongue.

0:0 - Shoo the rat away.
uid: 00890d08-de30-0781-61e6-52b38de07c1f
> *Squeee!*

0:0 - I mourn them. I mourn me. It's your fault - you filled my skull with full of pain and dead mens' faces.
uid: 03f38234-3103-ba76-2c1f-ad748be5a0d9

Synopsis:
The player meets Balthazar, the necromancer, in his temporary command centre in the Shar temple. They find him at an altar, repairing one of his damaged undead, while other minions bustle around. Balthazar has been sent by Ketheric Thorm to recover Nightsong, but has been unable to clear a path to her vault. He decides to recruit the player, upon recognising them as tadpoled. The player can agree or decline, and can possibly persuade him to loan his flesh golem to aid their exploration.

0:0 - Our Lady of Silver. Hear me!
She Who Guides, the Moonmaiden Selûne -
MOTHER OF THE SO-CALLED NIGHTSONG.
THE NIGHTSONG IS NO MORE!
uid: c97c5c5c-0ce1-3beb-4140-2185abadae62
Animation: [GOLD] NS: steps from the cage and drops to the ground, finally free of her 100 year imprisonment. She begins pounding her fist in a rhythm and slowly rises to her feet in triumph.
Cinematic: She kneels, head down, allowing the player to lay a hand upon her shoulder. As the hand makes contact, the hands appear upon her again - they glow and burs/ fade awayt. She steps forward nervously and stumbles, not having been free in a century and momentarily dizzied by the prospect of it. She catches herself on hand and knees, her head hanging. She begins to beat the ground with a fist in a slow, powerful rhythm. Then, she begins to hum an ancient, almost Gregorian chant. As she hums, the sound of it echoing through the Shadowfell builds and morphs into a chorus humming in harmony with her. She raises herself to her feet, but the rhythm continues, as does the song, independently of her. As the music swells, Nightsong raises her voice in an invocation
Node context: Shouted to the heavens.

Her wounds heal, and her rusted, dirty armour and torn clothes begin to mend. uid: fea1d3df-412b-e8a0-cc93-3fdb317dd06b

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_NightsongPrison_NightsongsFate.lsj
Synopsis:
The player encounter Nightsong, an angelic Aasimar and daughter of Selune who has been trapped in the Shadowfell for a century, first to serve as fodder for Dark Justiciars to kill (they must kill a Selunite to ascend), and then to provide Ketheric with immortality through a soul cage. The player can meet her either alone or with Balthazar. Nightsong is defiant and full of rage. She is immortal, so her current trials are, for her, an annoyance, an indignity, but she knows she will ultimately have her revenge. She regards the player with haughty defiance until she is convinced the player is on her side. If she's freed, she'll have 2 big cinematics of becoming free and cleansed by Selune.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_Orthon.lsj
Synopsis:
This occurs if the player has successfully convinced the orthon to let them stay in his lair. They did so by telling him they'd search the temple for a way of freeing him from his contract. If the player resolves the Last Justiciar contract, they can inform Yurgir. If they killed the justiciar, Raphael will appear and negotiate with Yurgir. If the player spared the justiciar, they can confront and fight Yurgir.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shar\SHA_Raphael.lsj
Synopsis:
Raphael is encountered at the beginning of the Shar Temple. He briefs the player about the Orthon - the devil he mentions - either telling them that he personally wants it dead, or that it is between the player and their objective. He then saves them from a trap and warns them about the dangers of the temple, before vanishing. !!! Don't remove REALLY_ASTARION tag check from the OOM branch!!!

Player meets the skeletons controlled by Balthazar, the Necromancer, who is barricaded elsewhere in the temple. His skeletons meet the player in the hallway. Synopsis:

0:0 - *A macabre arrangement of flesh. Only a truly depraved mind could dream of such a thing.*
0:1 - *A ghoulish display. It is clear the victim suffered greatly before dying and being put on show.*
0:2 - *A foul totem of agony, mounted with sadistic relish.*
uid: 0667bd27-be1e-4383-9f4e-bfde96086f9b
